result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Colton J. Zarecki

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Colton J. Zarecki in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF403, 15CF23, 15CF50
9:04 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

State files amended information in 14CF403.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF403 Counts 1 thru 4 of the amended information - GUILTY
15CF23 Counts 2 & 3 - GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF403 Counts 1 thru 4, 15CF23 Counts 2 & 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

15CF50 is dismissed and read-in. 
15CF23 Count 1 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
14CF403 Counts 1 & 2:
Sentence withheld.
24 months probation
Continue with alcohol program. 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, if he hasn't done so.
Absolute sobriety including controlled substances. 
Maintain employment. 
Apologize to Brad Blenker and Scott Bergman.
Pay restitution of $767.96 plus the surcharge.
Pay costs.
60 days conditional jail time, consecutive, Stayed at agents discretion. 

14CF403 Counts 3 & 4:
90 days jail on each count, concurrent
Court finds defendant eligible for huber. 

15CF23 Counts 2- 
6 months jail - Stayed
Court finds defendant eligible for huber.
24 months probation, concurrent:
Same conditions as 14CF403 Counts 1 & 2

Count 3 
30 days jail concurrent - Stayed
Court finds defendant eligible for huber.
24 months probation, concurrent:
Same conditions as 14CF403 Counts 1 & 2

Bonds to be applied to restitution.  Any balance will be applied to the fines and costs.
Pre-trial conference on April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Informations.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of informations. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bonds Continued.

Defendant Colton J. Zarecki in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Atty Renc indicates they are prepared to waive the prelim on this file and 15CF23 which is set for 3:00 today. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADA  Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

1:19 PM Court calls case.

ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of Felony Bailjumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
9210 Monroe Street is where Defendant lives, lives with his mother.
Defendant works at Toppers Pizza.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 

State requests a cash bond of $750  with conditions as stated.

Defendant requests a $300 to $500 cash bond for reasons stated on the record.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  February 23, 2015  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2

Defendant is remanded to custody of Sheriff's Dept pending posting of bond.
